fields.summary: [iOS] Some data types become unavailable from archive in specific case

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
*Description of problem*:
Some data types become unavailable from archive in specific case

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# start app and log in to account
# create backup of calendars/reminders/contacts
#* each displayed in archive during browsing
# add photos and start backup
# cancel backup and check protections in archive
#* calendars/reminders/contacts + photos displayed
# add videos protection and remove all other
# start backup
# check protections in archive
	
*Actual results*:
* only "video" protection displayed in archive

*Expected results*:
* all protections should be available
	
*Environment/OS*:
* iOS build 1727
* ATI 6116 build
	
*Additional info*:
* reproduced in cloud (RU2 with 1546 WRM)

fields.summary: [iOS] Yahoo calendar events are restored with a several hours offset (TZ info is lost?)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
*Description of problem*: Events recovered from a Yahoo calendar backup have a time offset from the original value.

*How reproducible*: Stable 

*Steps to Reproduce*:

# Add a Yahoo account to iPhone and enable calendar sync
# Create an event in the Yahoo calendar
# Set up Acronis True Image Cloud (b. 1225)
# Sign in using a backup account
# Check 'Calendars' and run a backup
# Delete the event from the Yahoo calendar
# In True Image go to 'Access and Recovery'
# Select the backed up version of that calendar and recover it
	
*Actual results*:
* Event is restored to the Yahoo calendar, but is set to a different time.
E.g. original start time is 12:00 (event created on the phone, seen as 12 PM through the web).
After restore it is seen as 15:00 in the Calendar app on the phone,
and as 16:00 (4 PM) in the web interface of the Yahoo calendar.

*Expected results*:
* Event is restored to the Yahoo calendar with its original start/end times (proper TZ).
	
*Environment/OS*:
iPhone 6 Plus (iOS 8.4.1)

*Additional Information*:
* This happens only once, i.e. if you re-backup the restored event, delete and restore it again, it does not float further in time. Looks like TZ information is lost/misinterpreted somewhere.
* If a calendar is restored to a different (non-Yahoo) account, original timestamps are preserved.

fields.summary: [iOS] Reminder list items on the Exchange account with priority "none" became priority "med" after recovery to an iCloud account

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
*Description of problem*: 

*How reproducible*: Stable. 

*Steps to Reproduce*:

# Set up a Reminders list on an Exchange account (simple items, no priority)
# Set up Acronis True Image Cloud (b. 1225)
# Sign in using a backup account
# Check 'Reminders' and run a backup
# Remove the Exchange account from the phone
# In ATI go to 'Access and Recovery'
# Select the backed up version of that Reminders list and recover it
	
*Actual results*:
* List is recovered (to the iCloud account), however all items (including completed) have their priority set to !! (med).

*Expected results*:
* Original priority setting is retained after recovery. E.g. "none" should become "none".
	
*Environment/OS*:
iPhone 6 Plus (iOS 8.4.1)

fields.summary: [iOS] Yahoo events doesn't restored with test calendar to Exchange account

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
*Description of problem*:
Yahoo events doesn't restored with test calendar to Exchange account

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# create test calendar in Yahoo account with any test events
# backup only calendars
# remove yahoo account from device
# set default Exchange calendar in device
# start restore all yahoo calendars (default + test)
	
*Actual results*:
* All calendars restored to exchange account
* events from default calendar restored well
* events from test calendar *doesn't* restored (see restore logs)

*Expected results*:
* events from test calendar restored too
	
*Environment/OS*:
* iPhone 6 (iOS 8.4.1)
* account: maks017@mfsa.ru/qwerty123
	
*Additional info*:
* not reproduced for retore to original yahoo account

fields.summary: [iOS] Reminder lists restored with calendars

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
*Description of problem*:
Reminder lists restored with calendars

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# install app
#* app should not have permissions to data
# start app and log in to account with another mobile archives
#* clean device page should be appears
# click recover and select archive with calendars and reminders
# select only calendars for restore
# start restore
# give acces only for calendars
	
*Actual results*:
* App tryies restore reminder list too and crashes

*Expected results*:
* app restored only calendars (w/o reminders)
	
*Environment/OS*:
* iPhone 6
* beta-baas stand
* account: maks06 / qwe123QWE

*Description of problem*:
*How reproducible*:
* stable

*Steps to Reproduce*:

# create backup of reminders
# delete any calendar with reminders (reminder list in iOS device)

# set any default account (not original)
